titles.en: Chapter 12 – Mixing of the dead with the slaughtered

titles.ar: باب فِي لَحْمِ الْفَحْلِ عِنْدَ اغْتِلَامِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – Regarding the flesh of the stallion during its heat
Chapter 12 – Mixing of the dead with the slaughtered

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/55)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ كَانَتْ لَهُ غَنَمٌ وَ بَقَرٌ وَ كَانَ يُدْرِكُ الذَّكِيَّ مِنْهَا فَيَعْزِلُهُ وَ يَعْزِلُ الْمَيْتَةَ ثُمَّ إِنَّ الْمَيْتَةَ وَ الذَّكِيَّ اخْتَلَطَا فَكَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ بِهِ فَقَالَ يَبِيعُهُ مِمَّنْ يَسْتَحِلُّ الْمَيْتَةَ وَ يَأْكُلُ ثَمَنَهُ فَإِنَّهُ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having been asked about a man who had sheep and cows, and he was aware of the slaughtered from these, so he isolated it, and isolated the dead. Then the dead and the slaughtered got mixed up. So how should he deal with it?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should sell it to the one who considers the dead as permissible (to eat), and he can eat from its price, for there is no problem with it’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Once abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked about the case of a man who had sheep and cows and he separated the clean and the dead then they became mixed and about what he should do. He (the Imam) said, ‘He can sell it to one who considers dead animals lawful then use what he receives as payment; it is not unlawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/56)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِذَا اخْتَلَطَ الذَّكِيُّ وَ الْمَيْتَةُ بَاعَهُ مِمَّنْ يَسْتَحِلُّ الْمَيْتَةَ وَ يَأْكُلُ ثَمَنَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abu Magra, from Al Halby who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘When the slaughtered and the dead get mixed up, so sell it to the one who considers the dead to be permissible (to eat), and eat from its price’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from abu al-Mighra’ from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ‘If clean (properly slaughtered) become mixed with the dead ones, one can sell them to one who considers dead animals as lawful and use the payment that one receives.’”
